greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. A(x) satisfies: 3^n - 1 = Sum_{k=0..n} [x^k]A(x)^n and also satisfies: (3+z)^n - (1+z)^n + z^n = Sum_{k=0..n} [x^k](A(x)+z*x)^n for all z, where [x^k]A(x)^n denotes the coefficient of x^k in A(x)^n.
comment: More generally, if g.f. A(x) satisfies: m^n-b^n = Sum_{k=0..n} [x^k]A(x)^n, then A(x) also satisfies: (m+z)^n - (b+z)^n + z^n = Sum_{k=0..n} [x^k](A(x)+z*x)^n for all z and A(x)=(1+(m-1)*x+sqrt(1+2*(m-2*b-1)*x+(m^2-2*m+4*b+1)*x^2))/2.
example: From the table of powers of A(x) (A100226), we see that
3^n-1 = Sum of coefficients [x^0] through [x^n] in A(x)^n:
the main diagonal of which is A100227 = [1,5,13,33,81,197,477,...],
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Nov 28 2004
